blocks.text: Theory of the Amsler Planimeter. The principle upon which this instrument is based may be explained quite simply, using the following.
The area of region P is based on the portion of the outline traced by the instrument to A.

The tracing point P is regarded as moving from the position of P to P’ continually. The area can be regarded as a flow of two different parts: firstly, a sliding or translational movement from A to A’.
